title: Vision
subtitle: Environmental effects that heavily obscure vision, movement, and other activities.

rules.title: Lightly Obscured
rules.subtitle: Disadvantage on Perception checks (dim light, patchy fog, moderate foliage)
rules.description: Creatures in a lightly obscured area have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

rules.title: Heavily Obscured
rules.subtitle: Effectively blind (darkness, opaque fog, dense foliage)
rules.description: A creature effectively suffers from the blinded condition when trying to see something in a heavily obscured area.

title: Light
subtitle: The presence or absence of light creates three categories of illumination: bright light, dim light, and darkness.

rules.title: Bright Light
rules.subtitle: Bright light lets most creatures see normally
rules.description: Even gloomy days provide bright light, as do torches, lanterns, fires, and other sources of illumination within a specific radius.

rules.title: Dim Light
rules.subtitle: Dim light creates a lightly obscured area
rules.description:
Creates a lightly obscured area. An area of dim light is usually a boundary between a source of bright light, such as a torch, and surrounding darkness.

The soft light of twilight and dawn also counts as dim light. A particularly brilliant full moon might bathe the land in dim light.

rules.title: Darkness
rules.subtitle: Darkness creates a heavily obscured area
rules.description:
Creates a heavily obscured area.

Characters face darkness outdoors at night (even most moonlit nights), within the confines of an unlit dungeon, or in an area of magical darkness.

title: Special Senses
subtitle: Some creatures have extraordinary senses that allow them to survive in harsh conditions.

rules.title: Blindsight
rules.subtitle: Perceive surroundings without sight
rules.description: A creature with blindsight can perceive its surroundings without relying on sight, within a specific radius. Creatures without eyes, such as oozes, and creatures with echolocation or heightened senses, such as bats and true dragons, have this sense.

rules.title: Darkvision
rules.subtitle: Limited vision in darkness
rules.description: Many creatures, especially those dwelling underground, have darkvision. Within a specified range, a creature with darkvision can see in darkness as if the darkness were dim light, so areas of darkness are only lightly obscured as far as that creature is concerned. However, the creature can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

rules.title: Tremorsense
rules.subtitle: Perceive through vibrations
rules.description: A monster with tremorsense can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a specific radius, provided that the monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures. Many burrowing creatures, such as ankhegs and umber hulks, have this special sense.

rules.title: Truesight
rules.subtitle: Darkness and illusions don't affect creatures with truesight
rules.description:
A creature with truesight can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic.

Furthermore, the creature can see into the Ethereal Plane.

title: Obstacles
subtitle: Obstacles can provide cover, granting a bonus to defense.

rules.title: Half Cover
rules.subtitle: An obstacle blocks at least half the body (fence, furniture, creature)
rules.description:
A target with half cover has a +2 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.

A target has half cover if an obstacle blocks at least half of its body.

The obstacle might be a low wall, a large piece of furniture, a narrow tree trunk, or a creature, whether that creature is an enemy or a friend.

rules.title: Three-Quarters Cover
rules.subtitle: An obstacle blocks at least three-quarters of the body (portcullis, arrow slit)
rules.description:
A target with three-quarters cover has a +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.

A target has three-quarters cover if about three-quarters of it is covered by an obstacle.

The obstacle might be a portcullis, an arrow slit, or a thick tree trunk.

rules.title: Total Cover
rules.subtitle: An obstacle completely covers the body (wall, huge creature)
rules.description:
A target with total cover can't be targeted directly by an attack or a spell, although some spells can reach such a target by including it in an area of effect.

A target has total cover if it is completely concealed by an obstacle.
